channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Nancy takes Celtic job and promises 'exciting football'
item.description: Celtic have confirmed the appointment of Wilfried Nancy as their new manager on a two-and-a-half year contract.

item.title: I avoid social media to protect myself - Amorim
item.description: Not reading social media abuse is the "only way to survive in this world", says Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim.

item.title: Germany to host Women's Euro 2029 as England chase trophy hat-trick
item.description: Germany will host the 2029 Women's European Championship, Uefa announces.

item.title: 'Nowadays it's normal' - Amorim on 'surviving' online abuse
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim says he does not engage with social media in order to avoid any online abuse and "protect him and his family".

item.title: Man City hold off incredible Fulham fightback as Haaland passes milestone
item.description: Erling Haaland becomes the quickest player to reach 100 goals in Premier League history as Manchester City ramp up pressure on leaders Arsenal by fending off Fulham's impressive fightback in a nine-goal thriller.

item.title: Success in 2025 - are the Lionesses ready for 2026?
item.description: England capped off a successful 2025 with resounding victories over China and Ghana at home - so what shape are they in for World Cup qualification?

item.title: One start and 96 minutes - what has happened to Elliott?
item.description: Liverpool's Harvey Elliott has made just one Premier League start since moving on loan to Aston Villa in the summer - so what has gone wrong?

item.title: Paqueta warned but avoids extended ban for dissent
item.description: West Ham midfielder Lucas Paqueta is warned but avoids an additional ban from the FA for his reaction to being sent off against Liverpool.

item.title: How big a miss is Caicedo for Chelsea?
item.description: Chelsea will be without the suspended Moises Caicedo for their next three league games. How will they cope without him?

item.title: Injury-time Romero overhead kick rescues point for Spurs
item.description: Cristian Romero's superb 95th-minute overhead kick secures a dramatic point for Tottenham Hotspur against Newcastle United to ease the pressure on manager Thomas Frank.

item.title: Late Grealish goal gives Everton victory at Bournemouth
item.description: Jack Grealish hits a late winner for Everton at the Vitality Stadium to sentence Bournemouth to a fourth defeat in five games.

item.title: 'I'm so old the players don't respect me!' Guardiola reacts to nine-goal epic
item.description: Pep Guardiola jokes that he is "so old my players don't respect me" after Manchester City almost surrendered a four-goal lead against Fulham.

item.title: Barcelona come from behind to beat Atletico Madrid
item.description: Barcelona come from behind to beat Atletico Madrid and go four points clear at the top of La Liga.

item.title: Frank 'loves the mentality' of his Spurs side
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur manager Thomas Frank says his team showed great character to come from setbacks to finish 2-2 against Newcastle United.

item.title: 'Mad scientist' & 'next Luis Enrique' - who is Celtic boss Nancy?
item.description: Kheredine Idessane speaks to an MLS expert about the new Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy.

item.title: Newcastle penalty 'absolute VAR mistake' - Frank
item.description: Thomas Frank says awarding Newcastle a penalty after a holding incident between Dan Burn and Rodrigo Bentancur was an "absolute mistake" by VAR.

item.title: Racism, rape and death threats: One weekend of social media abuse in football
item.description: More than 2,000 extremely abusive social media posts were sent about managers and players in the Premier League and Women's Super League in a single weekend, a BBC investigation finds.

item.title: Village People and Robbie Williams to perform at World Cup draw
item.description: American disco group Village People and British superstar Robbie Williams are among the artists set to perform at Friday's World Cup draw in Washington DC.

item.title: What have we learned from Scotland in 2025?
item.description: As Scotland sign off 2025 with their second win of the year, BBC Scotland ponders what we have learned about the side in the last 12 months.

item.title: How Haaland set Premier League's 100-goal record
item.description: Erling Haaland smashed Alan Shearer's record of reaching 100 Premier League goals the quickest in Manchester City's thrilling 5-4 win at Fulham.

item.title: Saudi clubs set sights on Salah - Wednesday's gossip
item.description: Saudi Pro League clubs are eyeing Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah, while the Reds reopen talks with Marc Guehi, Manchester United target Olympiacos youngster Christos Mouzakitis, plus more.

item.title: Gary Lineker takes football podcast to Netflix
item.description: The Rest is Football will stream on Netflix during next summer's World Cup as part of a new deal.

item.title: What leagues have a winter break and when are they?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which leagues will have a winter break in football.

item.title: Chaos at the Cottage - can Man City fix defensive issues?
item.description: Manchester City just about hold on as Fulham fight back from 5-1 down to 5-4 - no wonder Pep Guardiola is concerned by his team's leaky defence.

item.title: 'As if she won the Champions League' - Kendall's special night
item.description: Lucia Kendall's night could not have felt more special and England boss Sarina Wiegman said her goal celebration was "like winning the Champions League".

item.title: Howe laments 'painful' end to game
item.description: Eddie Howe says Tottenham's late equaliser was a "painful" end to a game in which Newcastle had twice taken the lead.

item.title: Moyes hails 'excellent' Everton win
item.description: David Moyes praises Everton for an "excellent win" at Bournemouth.

item.title: 'We protect our own' - Nuno defends Paqueta's behaviour
item.description: West Ham manager Nuno Espirito Santo has defended Lucas Paqueta, saying he is "suffering" and "is sad", following the midfielder's red card in the club's 2-0 defeat at home to Liverpool.

item.title: 'Why would you do that?' - Sutton on Spurs fans booing
item.description: The Monday Night Club's Chris Sutton and Rory Smith discuss whether Tottenham Hotspur fans should be booing their own players.

item.title: 'He wasn't happy' - Slot on Salah's reaction after being dropped
item.description: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot says Mohamed Salah "wasn't happy" after being dropped for the team's 2-0 win at West Ham, but insists the striker responded as a "top professional" once the news had sunk in.

item.title: Ajax abandon match due to fireworks
item.description: Ajax are forced to halt their Dutch League match against Groningen and later abandon due to supporters igniting fireworks and flares.

item.title: I won the Euros on my period - England's Mead
item.description: BBC Bitesize's new three-part series 'Girls in PE: Breaking Down the Barriers' takes a look at why so many teenage girls continue to drop out of PE at school.

item.title: Eleven and hell - the cost of Newcastle's dropped points
item.description: Newcastle United have dropped more points from winning positions than any other side in the Premier League this season - the tally now stands at 11 after Tuesday's 2-2 draw with Tottenham.

item.title: When are Premier League players heading to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains when players will meet up with their countries at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Positive signs, but Isak at Liverpool still a 'work in progress'
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer says that Alexander Isak is showing positive signs but still needs to work on his connection with his Liverpool team-mates.

item.title: How 'sensational' James helped Chelsea stop Arsenal
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Micah Richards analyses how Reece James produced a "sensational" midfield performance to help 10-man Chelsea hold Premier League leaders Arsenal to a 1-1 draw at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: Presenter Woods 'OK' after collapsing on TV
item.description: Presenter Laura Woods says she is "OK" after collapsing while leading television coverage of England's friendly against Ghana on Tuesday.

item.title: Ex-England player arrested on suspicion of attempted rape
item.description: A former England and Premier League footballer has been arrested at Stansted Airport on suspicion of attempted rape.

item.title: ACL-hit female footballer's plea for more support
item.description: Lucy Connolly-Brame, 20, is raising money for private surgery after suffering a serious injury.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this week
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: Hillsborough police would have faced misconduct cases
item.description: A report finds 12 ex-police officers would have faced gross misconduct cases over the disaster under today's laws.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Tailenders host Felix White
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Felix White - and AI - with his predictions for the midweek Premier League fixtures.

item.title: 'Arsenal deserve to be clear - but who's best placed to challenge?'
item.description: MOTD pundit Alan Shearer explains where Chelsea and the rest of the chasing pack need to improve if they are going to challenge Premier League leaders Arsenal.

item.title: 'Bonds the embodiment of West Ham's spirit'
item.description: Billy Bonds, who has died at the age of 79, was one of the greatest players ever to represent West Ham United and one of the finest never to win a full England cap, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Which club has the most red cards in a Premier League season?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything looks at the record for most red cards in a Premier League season

item.title: 'Is this the start of Liverpool's life without Salah?'
item.description: Is this the start of Liverpool's life without Mohamed Salah after he was dropped for the 2-0 win at West Ham, asks chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: Speaking backwards and a manager at 13 - the Solskjaer story
item.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer discusses Manchester United, the career he'd have chosen if he wasn't in football, and the team he'd like to manage.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Who is one card away from suspension in the Premier League?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who is currently nearing a suspension in the Premier League.

item.title: A European giant - but what's happened to the modern-day Ajax?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the demise of Ajax in recent years and whether their fortunes could be about to change

item.title: When were Coventry last in the Premier League?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team take a look at when Coventry City were last in the Premier League and their chances of promotion.

item.title: Why are there 12pm and 2:05pm kick-offs in Premier League on Sunday?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why four kick-offs on Sunday have unusual start times

item.title: Why are Man Utd not playing on a Saturday for two months?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why Manchester United are not playing on a Saturday for two months

item.title: What's going on with fan disorder at European games?
item.description: Was the disorder of Young Boys fans at Aston Villa an isolated incident, or does it indicate something more prevalent?

item.title: Scotland midfielder Gilmour to have surgery
item.description: Scotland and Napoli midfielder Billy Gilmour is facing an extended absence after the Italian club confirm he will have surgery on Monday.

item.title: Player fined for mocking appearance of opponent born with cleft lip
item.description: Go Ahead Eagles striker Victor Edvardsen is fined by his club for mocking the appearance of an opponent born with a cleft lip in a Europa League game.

item.title: Van Persie gives son debut 'as a coach - not as a dad'
item.description: After Shaqueel van Persie was given his senior debut by his father Robin, BBC Sport picks out other father-son duos in football.

item.title: BBC secures rights to show La Liga clips until 2027
item.description: BBC Sport has secures the rights to show La Liga highlights in the UK in a deal which runs until 2027.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
